definitions.text: the rapid and continuous delivery of linguistic communication (spoken or written)
examples: a bombardment of mail complaining about his mistake

definitions.text: the heavy fire of artillery to saturate an area rather than hit a specific target
examples: they laid down a barrage in front of the advancing troops
the shelling went on for hours without pausing

definitions.text: address with continuously or persistently, as if with a barrage
examples: The speaker was barraged by an angry audience
The governor was bombarded with requests to grant a pardon to the convicted killer
